sentence.Network_en: After much legal disputation our right to resign was established.
sentence.Network_cn: 经过大量法庭辩论后，我们辞职的权利得到了认可。

sentence.Network_en: Religion is a diffuse topic liable to unending disputation whereas theism is not.
sentence.Network_cn: 宗教是一个容易引起无休止争论的弥散型话题,而有神论则不是.

sentence.Network_en: It is a matter of disputation whether they did the right thing.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们做得对还是错,这是争议之处.

PerfectNetExp.abs: disputation 争议性, disputation 权位, disputation 半戏剧形式
Andare some unclear expressions in clauses , inducing much disputation in practice ., 还有 , 条文中的有些措辞不甚明了 , 这些都是实践中争议的根源.
disputable 可争议的, disputation 中式簿记, disputant 冲突者
disputation 争议, disputation 半戏剧形式, disputation 争议性

list.abs: 争奇斗艳的意思 - 已解决 - 搜搜问问 ... 同本义[ contend;vie;strive] 辩论;争论[ argue;dispute] 争斗[ struggle].
TOEIC词汇汇总 ... demand 要求；强求 15、 dispute 争端；争执；纠纷； 16、 negotiation 协商；谈判 17、.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin disputatio(n-), from the verb disputare (see dispute)

entry.def: Disputation is discussion on a subject which people cannot agree about.

example.ex: After much legal disputation our right to resign was established.
example.tran: 经过大量法庭辩论后，我们辞职的权利得到了认可。

means.word_mean: 1. the formal presentation of and opposition to a stated proposition (usually followed by a vote)
2. a contentious speech act; a dispute where there is strong disagreement;

sentences.sentence: "they were involved in a violent argument"
